question: Which country houses the "Demerara Harbour Bridge"?
explanation: The Demerara Harbour Bridge is a 6,074-foot-long floating toll bridge, located in Guyana. It was commissioned on 2 July 1978. The bridge crosses the Demerara River south of the Guyanese capital Georgetown, from Peter's Hall. There is a pedestrian footwalk. The bridge was only designed to last 10 years, yet it is still going strong.
